ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 574
ygData.msgSnippet: We know this because you can see previews of the maps on EQ main site. I agree - Verant would be better served to support Muse and EQAtlas. ...
ygData.messageBody:
We know this because you can see previews of the maps
on EQ main site. I agree - Verant would be better
served to support Muse and EQAtlas.

--- EverQuest@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> ------------------------ Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at
> http://www.everquest.com
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> There is 1 message in this issue.
>
> Topics in this digest:
>
> 1. RE: Digest Number 573
> From: "Steven R. Hulse"
> <shulse7@...>
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 1
> Date: Fri, 30 Aug 2002 21:07:31 -0600
> From: "Steven R. Hulse" <shulse7@...>
> Subject: RE: Digest Number 573
>
> No offense but how do you know this? Of course they
> aren't going to put
> that kind of info on there, they probably would
> consider that a
> "spoiler". I think the book would be handy for like
> off-line research
> and maybe the new RPG coming out. EQ Atlas is still
> an excellent source,
> maybe this book is Verant's answer to several
> requests for maps from
> them. As you said, part of the point of the game is
> exploring, what good
> would it be to have that info on the map, you'll
> know exactly where you
> need to go and never "explore".
>
> Durgaa
> Lvl 11 Wood Elf Ranger (Causality)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> Message: 3
> Date: Fri, 30 Aug 2002 08:12:18 -0700 (PDT)
> From: Toni <silly_girl4ever@...>
> Subject: Re: Forthcoming Atlas
>
>
> Don't forget that Part of the point of the game is
> exploring. People
> shouldn't know every little detail of a zone they
> have not been in
> before.
> I do know that the atlas that verant is putting out
> is not nearly as
> detailed as the maps done by EQ atlas. It will be a
> topographical map
> and nothing more. No landmarks, no points of
> interest. There will be
> no info about what mobs are in the zone etc.
>
> Personally I will stick with EQ atlas for now, the
> maps are detailed
> enough that I don't get lost (usually) and I can
> usually find what I am
> looking for after adventuring for a little bit =D
>
> Katashaka Naboombu
> 47 Vah Shir Shaman Claws of NIght
>
> Gwenevieve
> 30 High Elf Cleric of Tunare Claws of Night
>
>
>
>
>
